intro: Pectinaria articulata var. namaquensis, commonly known as theNamaqua daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a compact growth habit with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. This species is often found in theNamaqua region of South Africa, where it thrives in full sun.
